lines.text: What do you think could have happened to her?
Why, it's staring you in the face! She's gone off with a chap, that's what.
I don't believe it. Our Jenny would never do a thing like that.
Trust you to stick up for her. Well, what else can it mean?
I don't know. Perhaps she's been kidnapped or something. Maybe I ought to go to the police.
You'll do no such thing. Isn't it enough for you that she's disgraced us, without telling the whole of Hindle?
We've no proof that she has.

Kidnapped indeed! She put yesterday's date on the card, the sly, artful little... oh, I tell you she's gone off with a chap. And it's you who're to blame Chris Hawthorn, for never having taken a stick to her!
Sit down man, you'll gain nothing wearing out the carpet!
We'll talk of this again in the morning. Go to your room now, Jenny.
Call yourself a man? If it had been me, my father would have taken a stick to me!
A stick won't take back what she's done.
He's a gay young dog, isn't he!
If I weren't a girl of such strong principles, I'd marry you like a shot.
But darling, if I didn't have such strong principles, I probably wouldn't have forgiven you in the first place.
